meanings.definition: A plant of the genus Saponaria, especially Saponaria officinalis, known for its soapy properties when crushed.
meanings.sent1: The soapworts in the garden have pretty pink flowers.
meanings.sent2: I learned that soapworts can be used to make natural soap.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to wash its paws with soapworts!
meanings.sent4: Her words were like soapworts, cleansing the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The children giggled as they rubbed soapworts on their hands, pretending it was magic soap.

meanings.definition: The dried leaves or roots of the soapwort plant used for making soap.
meanings.sent1: Grandma used soapworts to make her own soap at home.
meanings.sent2: The soapworts smelled fresh and clean as they dried in the sun.
meanings.sent3: The cat mistook the soapworts for catnip and rolled around in them!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter bubbled up like a pot of boiling soapworts.
meanings.sent5: The soapworts transformed into luxurious bubbles when added to warm water.
